opendial.bn.distribs

Class EmpiricalDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.distribs.EmpiricalDistribution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MultivariateDistribution

    public class EmpiricalDistribution
extends java.lang.Object
implements MultivariateDistribution
    Distribution defined "empirically" in terms of a set of samples on a collection of random variables. This distribution can then be explicitly converted into a table or a continuous distribution (depending on the variable type).
    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-10-16 00:07:06 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

        public ContinuousDistribution toContinuous()

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • getMarginal

        public IndependentProbDistribution getMarginal(java.lang.String var)
        Returns an independent probability distribution on a single random variable based on the samples. This distribution may be a categorical table or a continuous distribution.
        Specified by:
        getMarginal in interface MultivariateDistribution
        Parameters:
        var - the random variable Xi
        Returns:
        the probability distribution resulting from the marginalisation.

      • getMarginal

        public ProbDistribution getMarginal(java.lang.String var,
                                    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> condVars)
                             throws DialException
        Returns a distribution P(var|condvars) based on the samples. If the conditional variables are empty, returns an independent probability distribution.
        Parameters:
        var - the head variable
        condVars - the conditional variables
        Returns:
        the resulting probability distribution
        Throws:
        DialException - if the distribution could not be generated.

      • createConditionalTable

        public ConditionalTable createConditionalTable(java.lang.String headVar,
                                               java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> condVars)
        Creates a conditional categorical table derived from the samples. This method should be called in the presence of conditional variables.
        Parameters:
        headVar - the name of the head variable
        condVars - the conditional variables.
        Returns:
        the conditional categorical table

      • pruneValues

        public void pruneValues(double threshold)
        Prunes all samples that contain a value whose relative frequency is below the threshold specified as argument. DoubleVal and ArrayVal are ignored.
        Specified by:
        pruneValues in interface MultivariateDistribution
        Parameters:
        threshold - the frequency threshold

        Returns true if the set of samples is not empty.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
